explanation: Not correct. The fact that this function only stores the pointer and tests it for NULL locally does not by itself prove a MISRA 8.13 violation. Rule 8.13 requires pointers to point to const-qualified types whenever possible across their actual use; you must consider the pointed-to object’s intended mutability and all uses of the stored pointer (filesys->address) elsewhere. In this code the parameter is assigned into the internal record (filesys->address). If that record member or downstream code intends to modify the pointed-to memory (or expects a non-const pointer), the parameter must be non-const. The shown snippet alone does not demonstrate that the pointer target is never modified anywhere in the program, so you cannot conclude a violation from this function alone. Therefore Agent A’s report (that this code violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13) is not justified based on the provided evidence.
